conflictDescription: User Story A requires informal and natural language avoiding rigid formality, while User Story B demands strictly formal language to maintain respect and clear boundaries. These opposing language styles cannot coexist simultaneously under the same conditions.
conflictingNfrPairs: Use informal language in ALFRED's speech
Ensure all conversations use formal language
Avoid rigid or overly formal expressions in ALFRED's speech
Ensure all conversations use formal language
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to speak informally and naturally so I feel comfortable and connected without any rigid formality.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want all conversations and messages, including those with family and friends, to be formal and polite to maintain respect and clear boundaries.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to reflect context-sensitive language use: informal language is used in casual or personal interactions to enhance comfort, while formal language is used in conversations requiring respect and clear boundaries. This conditional approach resolves the conflict by separating usage scenarios.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to use informal and natural language in casual interactions so I feel comfortable and connected.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Use informal language in casual conversations
Avoid rigid or overly formal expressions during personal interactions
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to use formal and polite language in conversations requiring respect and clear boundaries.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Use formal and polite language in respectful or official conversations
Maintain clear boundaries through appropriate speech style
